title: 3 Prosecutors Quit After Push to Investigate ICE Shooting Victim’s Widow
summary: Joseph H. Thompson, a career federal prosecutor who was the acting U.S. attorney for Minnesota last year, quit after the Justice Department sought to examine the woman’s supposed ties to activist groups.

title: FBI’s ICE Shooting Inquiry Examines Renee Good’s Possible Ties to Activist Groups
summary: Former department officials warned that such a broad inquiry raised the specter that forms of political protests could be criminalized.

title: Trump Suggests Renee Good’s ‘Disrespectful’ Attitude Justified Fatal ICE Shooting
summary: President Trump suggested that Renee Good’s “highly disrespectful” attitude toward law enforcement played a role in her fatal shooting by an ICE agent.

title: Facing Contempt Threat, Clintons Refuse to Testify in Epstein Inquiry
summary: The couple escalated their battle with Representative James R. Comer, the chairman of the Oversight Committee, who said he would move to hold them in contempt of Congress.

title: As Iran’s Government Tries to Quell Protests, Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge
summary: As many as 3,000 feared dead as witnesses describe government forces firing on unarmed protesters.

title: Trump Urges Antigovernment Protesters in Iran to ‘Take Over’
summary: “HELP IS ON ITS WAY,” President Trump said on social media. He has threatened to intervene militarily on behalf of the protesters if Iran uses lethal force.

title: Son of Deposed Shah of Iran Seeks Center Stage Amid Protests
summary: Reza Pahlavi, living in exile in the United States, has long marketed himself as a future leader of Iran. His father’s repressive legacy casts a long shadow.

title: That Restaurant You Love Will Close One Day. What to Do?
summary: Beloved places to dine out are portals to past versions of ourselves. But they keep disappearing.

title: CPI Report Shows Inflation Remained Steady at 2.7% in December
summary: Surging grocery prices were offset by lower increases for appliances and vehicles in the last such report before the Federal Reserve meets to debate interest rates.

title: CPI Report Shows Food Prices Rose Sharply in December
summary: Beef, coffee and produce were among the items that surged in price, inflation data showed.

title: Initial Obamacare Enrollment Drops by 1.4 Million as Expiring ACA Subsidies Drive Up Premiums
summary: That number could increase significantly as more consumers are faced with higher bills brought on by expiring premium subsidies.

title: The House Republican Majority Is Down to Almost Nothing
summary: Unexpected vacancies have whittled the G.O.P.’s edge to just a couple of votes, leaving Speaker Mike Johnson with almost no margin for leading the chamber.

title: Facing Political Pressure, Trump Seeks Answer to Rising Housing Costs
summary: White House officials have explored a vast array of ideas as the president looks to unfurl a housing affordability plan at an economic conference this month.

title: The Quest to ‘Make America Fertile Again’ Stalls Under Trump
summary: Administration officials have been urging Americans to get married and procreate, but some conservatives are frustrated by a lack of action.

title: C. Thi Nguyen Explains Our Gamified World in His New Book, ‘The Score’
summary: In a new book, C. Thi Nguyen looks to his personal passions — from video games to yo-yoing — to illuminate the downside of our increasingly gamified world.

title: U.S. Attacked Boat With Aircraft That Looked Like a Civilian Plane
summary: Even accepting the Trump administration’s claim that there is an armed conflict with suspected drug runners, the laws of war bar “perfidy.”

title: Venezuela’s Oil Riches Are Years Off, but Winners and Losers Will Emerge
summary: Companies that already have operations in the country stand to benefit, but those that have profited from a standoff between Caracas and Washington could lose out.

title: ‘We Need to Be the News’: Inside Bari Weiss’s Bumpy Revamp at CBS
summary: Her reimagining of “CBS Evening News” is under heavy scrutiny, and even became a punchline on her own network on Sunday at the Golden Globes.

title: Scott Adams, Creator of the Satirical ‘Dilbert’ Comic Strip, Dies at 68
summary: His chronicles of a corporate cubicle dweller was widely distributed until racist comments on his podcast led newspapers to cut their ties with him.

title: China’s ‘Dr. Frankenstein’ Thinks Time Is on His Side
summary: He Jiankui spent three years in prison after creating gene-edited babies. Now back at work, he sees a greater opening for researchers who push boundaries.

title: Hochul’s State of the State Quandary: How Far to the Left Will She Lean?
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York is expected to adopt some of the affordability message of Mayor Zohran Mamdani of New York City as she faces a contested re-election bid.

title: A Governor’s Legacy: Fewer Shootings, Free College and Covid Deaths
summary: After eight years as governor of New Jersey, Philip D. Murphy, a former ambassador to Germany and Goldman-Sachs executive, is leaving office. Mikie Sherrill will be sworn in on Jan. 20.

title: What High School Seniors Wrote in Their College Admissions Essays
summary: Some students are still mentioning their race or immigrant status as the Trump administration cracks down on diversity efforts. But many are avoiding sensitive aspects of their identity.

title: At This Office Park, Scamming the World Was the Business
summary: Times journalists got a rare look inside one of the compounds where the online fraud industry makes its billions. Inspirational slogans (“Keep going”) were just the start.

title: Inside a Scam Complex’s Detailed Playbook
summary: The scammers at a vast office park in Myanmar wielded deepfake technology, doctored videos and pinpoint conversational ploys that differed by the ages and nationalities of their victims.

title: How Readers Voted on 17 Ways to Improve New York City
summary: The top suggestions include spending more of the city’s budget on parks and libraries and fixing the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway.

title: If Power Corrupts, What Do We Have Here?
summary: Trump claims that the only limits on what he can do are his mind and his morality. What could go wrong?

title: A.I. Is Real. But OpenAI Might Still Fail.
summary: Artificial intelligence’s promise is real. But some of the most prominent A.I. companies might not make it.

title: Jon Stewart Skewers Trump as ‘Acting President of Venezuela’
summary: “Doesn’t your oath of office to America have a noncompete?” the “Daily Show” host asked President Trump.

title: Ask The Morning: ICE and Deportations
summary: Have questions about the Trump administration’s deportation efforts? We will try to find answers.

title: Gavin Newsom Vows to Stop Proposed Billionaire Tax in California
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom said he was working behind the scenes to block a proposed tax on billionaires’ wealth and was committed to defeating the measure if it reached the ballot.

title: Trump Says London is Unsafe. Its Murder Rate Just Hit a Historic Low.
summary: The city’s homicide rate is lower than that of New York, Paris or Toronto, contradicting a narrative promoted by President Trump and others on the populist right.

title: Prosecutors Seek Death Penalty for Former South Korea President
summary: Former President Yoon Suk Yeol faces an insurrection​ charge after his failed attempt to put his country under martial law in 2024.

title: Gourmet Magazine Is Back. It’s Not Exactly Sanctioned.
summary: The defunct food publication is re-emerging as a newsletter, with new leadership and zero approval from its original owner.
